Key Match Events: Nick Castellanos walked off with an RBI single in the ninth inning to give the Phillies a 7-6 win over the Mets in Game 2 of the NLDS.
Edwin Diaz struggled in the eighth inning, allowing a two-run triple to Bryson Stott which put the Mets in a 5-4 deficit.
Luis Severino allowed three earned runs over six innings, including consecutive home runs by Bryce Harper and Nick Castellanos in the sixth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Brandon Nimmo expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback loss.
Carlos Mendoza highlighted Edwin Diaz's performance and the team's determination to return home for the playoffs.
Mark Vientos celebrated his game-tying home run in the ninth inning with the Mets trailing 7-6.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was tied 6-6 in the ninth inning after Mark Vientos' home run.
The Phillies and Mets were both determined to win and advance in the playoffs.
The article mentions the Mets' journey and resilience throughout the playoffs.
